text: Simplify \(\frac{2\sqrt{2} - \sqrt{3}}{\sqrt{2} + \sqrt{3}}\)
explanation:
\(= \frac{2\sqrt{2} - \sqrt{3}}{\sqrt{2} + \sqrt{3}} \times \frac{\sqrt{2} - \sqrt{3}}{\sqrt{2} - \sqrt{3}}\)\(= \frac{2\sqrt{2}(\sqrt{2}) + (2\sqrt{2})(-\sqrt{3})-\sqrt{3}(\sqrt{2})-\sqrt{3}(-\sqrt{3})}{(\sqrt{2})^2-(\sqrt{3})^2}\)\(= \frac{2 \times 2 - 2\sqrt{6} - \sqrt{6} + 3}{2 - 3}\)\(= \frac{4 - 3\sqrt{6} + 3}{-1}\)\(= \frac{7 - 3\sqrt{6}}{-1}\)\(= \frac{7}{-1} - \frac{3\sqrt{6}}{-1}\)\(= -7 + 3\sqrt{6}\)\(= 3\sqrt{6}-7\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Find y, if \(\begin{pmatrix}5 & -6 \\2 & -7\end{pmatrix}\begin{pmatrix}x \\ y \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix}7 \\-11\end{pmatrix}\)
explanation:
\(\begin{pmatrix}5 & -6 \\2 & -7\end{pmatrix}\begin{pmatrix} x \\ y \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix}7 \\-11\end{pmatrix}\)By matrices multiplication;5x - 6y = 7 ........(1)2x - 7y = -11 ......(2)2 x (1): 10x - 12y = 14 .......(3)5 x (2): 10x - 35y = -55 ......(4)(3) - (4): 23y = 69y = 69/23 = 3
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: If \(\begin{vmatrix}-x & 12 \\-1 & 4 \end{vmatrix} = - 12\), find x.
explanation:
\(\begin{vmatrix}-x & 12 \\-1 & 4\end{vmatrix} = - 12\)-4x - (-1)12 = -12-4x + 12 = -12-4x = -12 - 12-4x = - 24x = 6
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Find the value of \(\begin{vmatrix}0 & 3 & 2 \\1 & 7 & 8 \\0 & 5 & 4\end{vmatrix}\).

\(0 \begin{vmatrix}7 & 8 \\5 & 4\end{vmatrix} -3 \begin{vmatrix}1 & 8 \\0 & 4\end{vmatrix} +2 \begin{vmatrix}1 & 7 \\0 & 5\end{vmatrix}\)= 0(28 - 40) - 3(4 - 0) + 2(5 - 0)= 0(-12) - 3(4) + 2(5)= 0 - 12 + 10= -2
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: How many sides has a regular polygon whose interior angle is 135°?
explanation:
If each interior angle of the polygon is 135°, then each exterior angle is 180° - 135° = 45°.
Hence, number of sides =\(\frac{360°}{\text{one exterior angle}}\)\(\frac{360°}{45°}\)= 8
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Calculate the mid point of the line segment y - 4x + 3 = 0, which lies between the x-axis and y-axis.
explanation:
y - 4x + 3 = 0When y = 0, 0 - 4x + 3 = 0Then -4x = -3x = 3/4So the line cuts the x-axis at point (3/4, 0).When x = 0, y - 4(0) + 3 = 0Then y + 3 = 0y = -3So the line cuts the y-axis at the point (0, -3)Hence the midpoint of the line y - 4x + 3 = 0, which lies between the x-axis and the y-axis is;\([\frac{1}{2}(x_1 + x_2), \frac{1}{2}(y_1 + y_2)]\)\([\frac{1}{2}(\frac{3}{4} + 0), \frac{1}{2}(0 + -3)]\)\([\frac{1}{2}(\frac{3}{4}), \frac{1}{2}(-3)]\)\([\frac{3}{8}, \frac{-3}{2}]\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

explanation:

text: A number is chosen at random from 10 to 30 both inclusive. What is the probability that the number is divisible by 3?
explanation:
Sample space S = {10, 11, 12, ... 30}Let E denote the event of choosing a number divisible by 3Then E = {12, 15, 18, 21, 24, 27, 30} and n(E) = 7Prob (E) = \(\frac{n(E)}{n(S)}\)Prob (E) = \(\frac{7}{21}\)Prob (E) = \(\frac{1}{3}\)

text: in the figure above, what is the equation of the line that passes the y-axis at (0,5) and passes the x-axis at (5,0)?
explanation:
(x1, y1) = (0,5)(x2, y2) = (5, 0)Using \(\frac{y - y_1}{y_2 - y_1} = \frac{x - x_1}{x_2 - x_1}\)\(\frac{y - 5}{0 - 5} = \frac{x - 0}{5 - 0}\)\(\frac{y - 5}{-5} = \frac{x}{5}\)5(y - 5) = -5xy - 5 = -xx + y = 5y = -x + 5

text: If the angle of a sector of a circle with radius 10.5 cm is 120°, find the perimeter of the sector. [Take \(\pi = \frac{22}{7}\)]
explanation:
Perimeter of the sector = \(2r + \frac{\theta}{360°} \times 2\pi r\)
= \(2(10.5) + \frac{120}{360} \times 2 \times \frac{22}{7} \times 10.5\)
= \(21 + 22\)
= 43 cm
There is an explanation video availablebelow.
